extendedIngredients.name: brown sugar
extendedIngredients.original: 3 tablespoons fine-grain natural cane sugar or brown sugar
extendedIngredients.originalName: fine-grain natural cane sugar or brown sugar

extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound Brussels sprouts, washed, ends trimmed off, and cut into 1/8-inch wide ribbons
extendedIngredients.originalName: Brussels sprouts, washed, ends trimmed off, and cut into 1/8-inch wide ribbons

extendedIngredients.name: extra firm tofu
extendedIngredients.original: 8 ounces extra-firm tofu, cut into thin 1-inch segments
extendedIngredients.originalName: extra-firm tofu, cut into thin 1-inch segments

title: Dinner Tonight: Caramelized Tofu with Brussels Sprouts
summary: Dinner Tonight: Caramelized Tofu with Brussels Sprouts is a gluten free and vegan main course. This recipe serves 2 and costs $2.39 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 13g of protein, 36g of fat, and a total of 492 calories. This recipe from Serious Eats has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. Head to the store and pick up brown sugar, peanut oil, cilantro, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the extra firm tofu you could follow this main course with the Vegan Soft Sugar Cookies as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 82%, this dish is great. Try Dinner Tonight: Brussels Sprouts with Chorizo, Dinner Tonight: Momofuku Brussels Sprouts, and Dinner Tonight: Welsh Rarebit with Brussels Sprouts for similar recipes.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Heat a large skillet and add the oil over medium heat.  Add the tofu with a pinch of salt and cook until lightly browned, then add the garlic and pecans and cook until the garlic is soft and fragrant, about one minute.                                                                                                                             2                                                                            Lower the heat and stir in the sugar, stirring often to avoid burning. Remove from heat and add the cilantro, then transfer to a warm plate.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Add the Brussels sprouts to the pan and stir and scrape to combine with any pan residue.  Season with salt and cook, stirring only occasionally to promote browning, until there are golden bits and the sprouts turn a brighter hue.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Transfer to plates, top with the tofu, and serve.

steps.step: Heat a large skillet and add the oil over medium heat.
Add the tofu with a pinch of salt and cook until lightly browned, then add the garlic and pecans and cook until the garlic is soft and fragrant, about one minute.
Lower the heat and stir in the sugar, stirring often to avoid burning.
Remove from heat and add the cilantro, then transfer to a warm plate.

Add the Brussels sprouts to the pan and stir and scrape to combine with any pan residue.  Season with salt and cook, stirring only occasionally to promote browning, until there are golden bits and the sprouts turn a brighter hue.
Transfer to plates, top with the tofu, and serve.
